description:
Tested on revision no. 853.

Steps to reproduce:-
1) Create user
$ nova/bin/nova-manage --flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf user create test

2) Add netadmin role o th newly added user
$nova/bin/nova-manage --flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf role add test netadmin

3) Create a new project "test" and assign "test" user as a projectmanager.
$nova/bin/nova-manage --flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf project test test

4) Download the credentials
nova/bin/nova-manage --flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf project zipfile test test test.zip

5) source . novarc after unzipping the above download credentials zip file.

6) $euca-authorize -P icmp -t -1:-1 default
I get the following error message:-
Warning: failed to parse error message from AWS: <unknown>:1:0: syntax error
EC2ResponseError: 401 Unauthorized
401 Unauthorized


This server could not verify that you are authorized to access the document you requested. Either you supplied the wrong credentials (e.g., bad password), or your browser does not understand how to supply the credentials required.

Expected Result: User with netadmin role should have access to AuthrorizeSecurityGroupIngress ec2 api.
title: User with netadmin and project manager roles cannot access AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress API

comments.content:
I can access AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress API If I add project specific role.
$nova/bin/nova-manage --flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf role add test netadmin test

I am marking this bug as Invalid.

But still I have couple of questions in my mind,
What is the purpose of adding user specific and not project specific role?
Where these user specific roles are getting used in nova?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tpatil

comments.content:
This is something that seems to confuse everyone that comes across it.  Actual roles are the intersection of user roles and project roles. It was originally added because user specific roles were needed to verify that the user has been certified to act in the capacity, whereas the project role specifies that the user is allowed to act in that capacity in the project.  Due to the confusion it seems better to use union (which is what most people expect).  Hence this wishlist item:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/697936
